sen.j: 西郷 寅太郎（さいごう とらたろう、1866年8月21日（慶応2年7月12日 (旧暦)） - 1919年1月1日）は、日本の大日本帝国陸軍軍人。
sen.e: Torataro SAIGO (August 21, 1866 - January 1, 1919) was a military man in the Imperial Japanese Army.
Torataro SAIGO (August 21, 1866 - January 1, 1919) was a military man of the Imperial Japanese Army.
Torataro SAIGO (August 21, 1866 - January 1, 1919) was a military man of the Imperial Japanese Army.

sen.j: 最終階級は陸軍大佐。
sen.e: His final position was Army Colonel.
His final position was Army Colonel.
His final position was Army Colonel.

tit.cmt: 統一用語に修正しました

sen.j: 薩摩国鹿児島城下上之園町で出生。
sen.e: He was born in Uenosono-cho near Kagoshima Castle in Satsuma Province.
He was born in Uenosono-cho, a castletown around Kagoshima-jo Castle in Satsuma Province.
sen.cmt: 原文のリンク先表示・英文の形式を修正しました
sen.e: He was born in Uenosono-cho, a castletown around Kagoshima-jo Castle in Satsuma Province.

sen.j: 東京俘虜収容所長・習志野俘虜収容所長・貴族院等を務める。
sen.e: He served as Tokyo Governor/Narashino Internment Camp Chief/Member of House of Peers and so on.
He served as Tokyo Internment Camp Chief, Narashino Internment Camp Chief, Member of the House of Peers, and so on.
sen.cmt: 原文のリンク先表示・英文の用語を修正しました
sen.e: He served as Tokyo Internment Camp Chief, Narashino Internment Camp Chief, Member of the House of Peers, and so on.

sen.j: 階級位階勲等功級爵位は陸軍歩兵大佐従三位勲二等功五級侯爵。
sen.e: His Kaikyu-kosho-ichiran-ikai-kunto-shakui (official name including ranks/ orders/peerage, etc.) was Rikugun-Taisa (Colonel of the Army)-Orders-of-Golden- Pheasant Marquis.
His official title (rank, order, decoration, grade, and peerage) was Rikugun hohei taisa (Army Colonel of Infantry), Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Second-class Order, Fifth Grade, and Marquis.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを加筆修正の上、用語を修正しました
sen.e: His official title (rank, order, decoration, grade, and peerage) was Rikugun hohei taisa (Army Colonel of Infantry), Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), Second-class Order, Fifth Grade, and Marquis.

sen.j: 陸軍大将西郷隆盛の嫡男で、母は糸子。
sen.e: He was a legitimate son of Takamori SAIGO and his mother was Itoko.
He was born as the legitimate heir to Army General Takamori SAIGO and his wife Itoko.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを加筆修正の上、用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: He was born as the legitimate heir to Army General Takamori SAIGO and his wife Itoko.

sen.j: 妻は園田実徳の子・信子。
sen.e: His wife is Nobuko, Saneyori SONODA's child.
His wife was Nobuko who was Sanenori SONODA's daughter.
sen.cmt: 誤訳・表現を修正しました
sen.e: His wife was Nobuko who was Sanenori SONODA's daughter.

sen.j: 元帥海軍大将西郷従道侯爵はおじにあたる。
sen.e: Marquis Tsugumichi SAIGO, Marshal Full Admiral was his uncle.
Marquis Tsugumichi SAIGO, Marshal Full Admiral, was his uncle.
Marquis Tsugumichi SAIGO, Marshal Full Admiral, was his uncle.

sen.j: 庶兄の西郷菊次郎は宜蘭支庁郡守、京都市長等を務める。
sen.e: Kikujiro SAIGO, his older brother by a concubine served as Giran Branch Office Governor, Mayor of Kyoto City and so on.
Kikujiro SAIGO, Torataro's illegitimate older half-brother, served as Yilan (Taiwan) Branch Office Governor, Mayor of Kyoto City and so on.
sen.cmt: 表現・用語を修正しました
sen.e: Kikujiro SAIGO, Torataro's illegitimate older half-brother, served as Yilan (Taiwan) Branch Office Governor, Mayor of Kyoto City and so on.

sen.j: 1877年（明治10年）に父隆盛が戦死する。
sen.e: In 1877, his father, Takamori was killed in the war.
In 1877, his father Takamori was killed in the war.
sen.cmt: 原文の脱字を対応ウェブ表記に準じて修正しました。形式を修正しました
sen.e: In 1877, his father Takamori was killed in the war.

sen.j: 隆盛は西南戦争の首魁（しゅかい）として官位を褫奪され、一族は鹿児島で密かに暮らしていた。
sen.e: Takamori being deprived of his court rank as a ringleader of the Seinan War, his family lived secretly in Kagoshima Prefecture.
After Takamori had been deprived of his court rank as a ringleader of the Seinan War (Satsuma Rebellion), his family and relatives lived secretly in Kagoshima.
sen.cmt: 原文のリンク先表示を削除しました。表現を修正しました。
sen.e: After Takamori had been deprived of his court rank as a ringleader of the Seinan War (Satsuma Rebellion), his family and relatives lived secretly in Kagoshima.

sen.j: 1884年（明治17年）に吉井友実や勝海舟等の働き掛けが功を奏し、明治天皇の思召しからポツダム陸軍士官学校留学を命ぜられ、13年もの間ドイツで学び、その間プロイセン陸軍少尉となる。
sen.e: In 1884 due to the successful appeal of Tomozane YOSHII and Kaishu KATSU to the government and Emperor Meiji's consideration, he was given an order to study in Potsdam Army War College, and while he was learning in Germany for thirteen years, he became a Prussian army junior lieutenant.
sen.cmt: ＊原文より（1884年（明治17年)） in 1884 を補いました
sen.e: In 1884, as a result of the successful appeal of Tomozane YOSHII, Kaishu KATSU and others to the government, Emperor Meiji ordered Torataro to study in Potsdam Army War College, and while he was studying in Germany for thirteen years, he became a Prussian army lieutenant.
sen.cmt: 原文の脱字を対応ウェブ表記に準じて修正しました。表現を修正しました。
sen.e: In 1884, as a result of the successful appeal of Tomozane YOSHII, Kaishu KATSU and others to the government, Emperor Meiji ordered Torataro to study in Potsdam Army War College, and while he was studying in Germany for thirteen years, he became a Prussian army lieutenant.

sen.j: 帰国後陸軍戸山学校射撃科を経て陸軍少尉に任じられる。
sen.e: After returning to Japan, he, having served in Army Toyama Shooting School, was appointed army junior lieutenant.
After returning to Japan, he was trained in shooting at Army Toyama School and was appointed army lieutenant.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: After returning to Japan, he was trained in shooting at Army Toyama School and was appointed army lieutenant.

sen.j: 6月3日父隆盛の維新の功により侯爵を授かり華族に列せられ、貴族院議員（侯爵議員）に就任する。
sen.e: Takamori was pardoned by the amnesty of the issuance of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan and was given Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).

On June 3, Torataro was conferred the title of Marquis and thus raised to the peerage on the ground of his father Takamori's achievements in the Restoration, thereafter becoming a member of the House of Peers (Marquis member).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ（全文）により再訳出しました
sen.e: On June 3, Torataro was conferred the title of Marquis and thus raised to the peerage on the ground of his father Takamori's achievements in the Restoration, thereafter becoming a member of the House of Peers (Marquis member).

sen.j: 隆盛は大日本帝国憲法発布の大赦で赦され、隆盛に正三位が贈られた。
sen.e: Takamori was pardoned by the amnesty of the issuance of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan and was given Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
Takamori was pardoned under an amnesty granted in honor of issuance of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, and was conferred a court rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Takamori was pardoned under an amnesty granted in honor of issuance of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, and was conferred a court rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).

sen.j: 第一次世界大戦中の1914年（大正3年）11月11日東京俘虜収容所長に就任、1915年（大正4年）9月7日習志野俘虜収容所長に移る。
sen.e: On November 11, during World War I, he assumed the position of Tokyo Interment Camp Chief and became Narashino Interment Camp Chief on September 7.
On November 11, 1914, during World War I, he assumed the position of Tokyo Internment Camp Chief, and on September 7, 1915, became Narashino Internment Camp Chief.
sen.cmt: 原文の脱字を対応ウェブサイトに準じて補足の上、加筆しました。
sen.e: On November 11, 1914, during World War I, he assumed the position of Tokyo Internment Camp Chief, and on September 7, 1915, became Narashino Internment Camp Chief.

sen.j: 1919年（大正8年）1月1日スペインかぜによる肺炎が元で在職中に薨去。
sen.e: On January 1 he died while in office due to pneumonia caused by the Spanish flu.
On January 1, 1919, he died while in office due to pneumonia caused by the Spanish flu.
sen.cmt: 原文の脱字を対応ウェブサイトに準じて補足の上、加筆しました。
sen.e: On January 1, 1919, he died while in office due to pneumonia caused by the Spanish flu.

sen.j: 同年1月5日特旨により従三位に叙せられる。
sen.e: On January 5 of the same year he was raised to Jusanmi by Emperor's wishes.
On January 5 in the same year he was granted Emperor's special consideration and was raised to Jusanmi.
On January 5 in the same year he was granted Emperor's special consideration and was raised to Jusanmi.

sen.j: 墓所は東京都・青山霊園。
sen.e: His grave is located in Aoyama Cemetery, Tokyo Metropolis.
His grave is located in Aoyama Cemetery managed by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government.
His grave is located in Aoyama Cemetery managed by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government.

sen.j: 家督は次男の西郷隆輝が継ぐが、隆輝に継嗣がいなかったため、その後を寅太郎の三男・西郷吉之助が継ぐ。
sen.e: His reigns of the family were succeeded by his second son, however, Takateru had no heir, so that Kichinosuke SAIGO, Torataro's third son succeeded the subsequent reigns.
The family estate was succeeded by Torataro's second son Takateru, but Takateru had no heir, so that Torataro's third son Kichinosuke SAIGO succeeded to Takateru.
sen.cmt: 用語・表現を修正しました
sen.e: The family estate was succeeded by Torataro's second son Takateru, but Takateru had no heir, so that Torataro's third son Kichinosuke SAIGO succeeded to Takateru.

sen.j: 吉之助は貴族院議員・参議院議員となり法務大臣を務める。
sen.e: Kichinosuke, having served as a member of the Kizokuin/Sangiin (the House of Councilors), became the Minister of justice.
Kichinosuke served as a member of the House of Peers and the House of Councilors, and became the Minister of justice.
Kichinosuke served as a member of the House of Peers and the House of Councilors, and became the Minister of justice.

sen.j: ちなみに、妻・ノブ（信子・隆輝、吉之助の母）の父・園田実徳は武豊・武幸四郎の曾祖父・武彦七の兄にあたるため、彼らは遠縁関係となる。
sen.e: For your information, Sanenori SONODA, the father of his wife, Nobu (the mother of Nobuko, Takateru and Kichinosuke) was the grandfather of Yutaka TAKE/KoshiroTAKE and the older brother of Hikoshichi TAKE, therefore, they are distantly-related.

Incidentally, Sanenori SONODA, father of Torataro's wife Nobu (mother of Nobuko, Takateru and Kichinosuke), was an old brother of Hikoshichi TAKE who was a great grandfather of Yutaka TAKE and Koshiro TAKE, that is, they are distant relatives.
sen.cmt: 原文の文末に、次項から閉じる括弧と句読点を移動・統合しました。また、文末に付随していた無意味な語句「（より）」は削除しました。また、表現・形式・訳漏れを修正しました
sen.e: Incidentally, Sanenori SONODA, father of Torataro's wife Nobu (mother of Nobuko, Takateru and Kichinosuke), was an old brother of Hikoshichi TAKE who was a great grandfather of Yutaka TAKE and Koshiro TAKE, that is, they are distant relatives.
